page.title: 05MASON ESTATE
page.content: THE MASON ESTATE IS NOW RUN BY LADY MASON AND MUCH OF THE LAND IS WOODED. THE AREA IS LOOKED AFTER BY OUTSIDE FIRMS. THE AGRICULTURAL LAND IS LEASED OFF TO FARMERS DEALT WITH LATER IN THE TEXT.FROM THE 16TH CENTURY THE MASON'S RENTED EATON HALL. IN 1820 THEY BOUGHT BEECHWOOD FARM FROM A MR.KIPPAX AND IN THE 1860'S CAME ONTO MONEY FROM COAL.THE HALL WAS BUILT AND THE GROUNDS LAYED OUT BY A MAN CALLED KAYE.A NEW HOUSE WAS BUILT IN 1949,THE OLD ONE BECOMING TOO COSTLY TO REPAIR.AN ESTIMATE TO REPAIR THE LEAD ROOF IN 1949 WAS Â£10000.THE STABLE BLOCK STILL REMAINS TODAY AND PROVIDES ACCOMODATION FOR THE GARDENER AND LADY MASON'BROTHER IN LAW CANON MASON WHO RETIRED FROM CHICHESTER.MANY VARIATIES OF PINE CAN BE FOUND AND THERE IS PLENTY OF GAME ALTHOUGH NOT BREED NOW.
